docs.title: Forest Py ToolsFP Tools features
docs.text:
Process forest management end-to-end, easy as can be.

With this library, you'll be able to plan forest inventories and volumetrics as well as process all data stemming from your forest plantation. FP Tools brings together various forestry processing methodologies into a single library, providing ease in model selection and forest performance analysis.

This library was created as a master's project by student Vinicius Richter, with the aim of facilitating the processing of forest inventory information.

docs.title: Inventário Florestal: Alocação de parcelas
docs.text:
Essa parte aqui é algum esquema pra instalação de parcelas de diversas formas em um arquivo .tiff, ainda não decidi se vai ser feito um plugin pro qgis ou se vai ser tudo feito por CLI com python.

arquivo_exemplo.py
def par_ou_impar(numero):
    if numero % 2 == 0:
        return "Par"
    else:
        return "Ímpar"

docs.title: Forest Inventory : Hypsometric Relationship
docs.text: In this module, you'll be able to perform the hypsometric relationship of a forest inventory using various equations as well as make use of artificial neural networks.

docs.title: Cubagem
docs.text: AQUI VAI TER INFORMAÇÕES APRESENTANDO O MÓDULO DE CUBAGEM DA BIBLIOTECA

docs.text: AQUI VAI TER INFORMAÇÕES APRESENTANDO O MÓDULO DE ESTRATIFICAÇÃO DA BIBLIOTECA

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To begin processing your forest data, as easily as possible, first install FP Tools.

pip install fptools

Aqui vai ter algumas instruções ensinando o usuário a fazer a instalação do pacote e dos recursos necessários

docs.title: Hypsometric Relationship
docs.text: Estimate the heights of the missing trees based on the heights measured in the field.

docs.title: Class Parameters
docs.text:
HypRel(x, y, df, model, iterator)
Parameters Description x The name of the column that contains the tree diameters. y The name of the column that contains the tree heights. df The DataFrame containing the tree data. model (Optional) A list of models used for estimating tree heights. If none, will use all models avaliable. iterator (Optional) A column name string. Defines wich column will be used as a iterator. Could be a farm name, plot name, code or any unique identification tag.

docs.title: Class Functions
docs.text:
HypRel.run()
HypRel.metrics()
HypRel.plots(dir,show=bool)
Parameters Description .run() Fit the models .metrics() Return a table of metrics of each evaluated model .plots() Return the height and residuals plots

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
hyp_rel_example.py
#import HypRel class
from fptools.hyp_rel import HypRel
#import pandas for data manipulation
import pandas as pd
flowchart LR subgraph run runText1[Run all the available models] end subgraph metrics runText2[Evaluate each fitted model] end subgraph plots runText3[Generate plots] end %% Links para os subgráficos: HypRel-Module --> run HypRel-Module --> metrics HypRel-Module --> plots

Create a variable for the HypRel Class

hyp_rel_example.py
#load csv file
df = pd.read_csv(r'C:\Your\path\csv_inventory_file.csv')
#create the variable "reg" containing the HypRel class
reg = HypRel('CAP',"HT",df)
#Run the models and save in the "results" variable
results = reg.run()
#Run a evaluation for the fitted models and save on "metrics" variable
metrics = reg.metrics()
#Return the plots for the fitted models. 
#If show=True, will print on screen all the heigth and residuals plots. #If a directory is passed, will save all the plots in the directory.
reg.plots('C:\Your\path\to_save',show=True)

docs.title: Artificial Neural Network
docs.text: FALTA DEFINIR A ESTRUTURA DE REDE QUE VAI SER USADA graph TD A[Input Neuron] --> B1[Hidden Neuron 1] A --> B2[Hidden Neuron 2] B1 --> C[Output Neuron] B2 --> C
